November 15, 1976 is the
application deadline for the Winston
Churchill Foundation Scholarships for
graduate study in Engineering,
Mathematics and Science at Churchill
College, Cambridge University,
England.
There are approximately ten awards
for either one year of graduate study
leading to a certificate of diploma, or
three years of graduate study leading
to a doctorate.
The annual stipend is $3,500 for a
one-year award, $4,000 for a
three-year award, a $500 travel grant,
plus allowances for dependents. Those
eligible are citizens of the United
States enrolled in one of the
institutions participating in the
Churchill Scholarship program,
between the ages of 19 and 26 who
are holders of a bachelor's degree
from a U.S. institution, or the
equivalent, by Octoqer 1, 1977.
Selection criteria include academic
record and GRE scores; capacity for
original, independent work; character,
breadth of interests and adaptability;
demonstrated concern for the critical
problems of society and good health.
For more detailed information and
applications see Professor Gordon
Feldman, Department of Physics,
Rowland 421, Campus
Representative.

The JHU soccer squad began

enthusiastic. This kind of victory

Haverford goal tender.

opportunity The rebound shot,

center forward Greg Cunningham

Babaturk crossed the ball to

the score.

defense. This led to their only
goal of the game, a goalpost
rebound shot.
